objects.name: PAP
objects.description: This defines PAP as a STIX extension

objects.name: Operation MacroMaze / Operation Neusploit
objects.description: Targeting European entities using weaponized documents with INCLUDEPICTURE tracking and webhook-based exfiltration. Also exploited a Microsoft Office zero-day (CVE-2026-21509) to deploy MiniDoor and PixyNetLoader.

objects.name: CVE-2026-21509
objects.description: Vulnerability CVE-2026-21509 referenced in threat report.

objects.content:
Sector: Government, Military, European entities

Modus operandi:
Spear-phishing, tracking pixels (INCLUDEPICTURE), VBA macros, webhook.site exfiltration, headless browser usage.

objects.name: Medusa Ransomware Adoption
objects.description: North Korean state-backed group (including sub-group Stonefly) is now utilizing Medusa Ransomware-as-a-Service to target U.S. healthcare and Middle Eastern organizations for financial gain and espionage funding.

objects.content:
Sector: Healthcare, Non-profits, Government

Modus operandi:
Ransomware-as-a-Service (Medusa), custom backdoors (Comebacker, Blindingcan), credential dumping (Mimikatz).

objects.name: Early 2026 Extortion Spree
objects.description: High-volume data theft and extortion targeting Wynn Resorts, CarGurus (12.4M records), and Dutch telecom Odido (8M customers). Threats include data leaks and unspecified digital disruptions.

objects.content:
Sector: Hospitality, Automotive, Telecommunications

Modus operandi:
Vishing, SSO account hijacking, OAuth application abuse, data leak site pressure.

objects.name: CVE-2025-40538
objects.description:
Broken access control in SolarWinds Serv-U allowing a malicious actor to create a system admin user and execute arbitrary code as root.

Affected product: Serv-U

Affected vendor: SolarWinds

CPE: cpe:2.3:a:solarwinds:serv-u:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

objects.name: CVE-2025-13942
objects.description:
Critical command injection vulnerability in the UPnP function allowing remote unauthenticated attackers to execute OS commands.

Affected product: 4G LTE/5G NR CPE, DSL/Ethernet Routers

Affected vendor: Zyxel

CPE: cpe:2.3:h:zyxel:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

objects.name: Breach: Vikor Scientific (Vanta Diagnostics)
objects.description:
Data breach affecting 140,000 patients due to a compromise at third-party supplier Catalyst RCM. Stolen data includes EMRs, billing info, and PII.

Sector: Healthcare

objects.name: Breach: Seoul Public Bike Service (Ttareungyi)
objects.description:
Breach exposing data of 4.62 million riders (90% of registered users) including IDs, phone numbers, and addresses. Two teenagers charged.

Sector: Public Transport

objects.abstract: Geopolitical analysis (EN) / Russian New Generation Warfare (NGW)
objects.content:
Sector: International Relations / NATO

Theme: Russian New Generation Warfare (NGW)

Russian military doctrine is evolving into a full-scale 'New Generation Warfare' campaign against NATO members, integrating cyberattacks, sabotage, and influence operations to degrade political unity and test defensive capabilities before 2028.

Tags: Russia, NATO, Hybrid Warfare, NGW

objects.name: Model Context Protocol (MCP) server scanning
objects.description: Tool: Model Context Protocol (MCP) server scanning

objects.name: LLMjacking and Cloud-AI Resource Theft
objects.description:
Industrialized monetization of unauthorized AI access (Operation Bizarre Bazaar). Threat actors steal compute cycles and API access to resell on underground markets via silver.inc.

Analysis:
LLMjacking has evolved from simple credential theft to a service-based economy. Attackers focus on Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers to bridge to internal infrastructure.

Recommendations:
- Monitor API usage for unusual patterns and rotate keys frequently.
- Treat internal AI endpoints as internet-facing assets with strict IAM controls.

objects.name: AI-Automated Credential Harvesting against FortiGate
objects.description:
A low-skill Russian-speaking actor used GenAI to automate reconnaissance and credential harvesting against over 600 FortiGate devices globally.

Analysis:
The campaign demonstrates how commercial LLMs lower the barrier for opportunistic attacks on exposed management interfaces.

Recommendations:
- Disable internet-facing management interfaces on firewalls.
- Enforce MFA for all administrative access.

objects.content: The threat landscape for late February 2026 is characterized by three major trends: the mass industrialization of AI-assisted cybercrime, a resurgence of critical infrastructure vulnerabilities, and the consolidation of state-sponsored ransomware tactics. Low-skill actors are now successfully compromising enterprise-grade firewalls (FortiGate) using commercial LLMs for automation. Meanwhile, APT groups like Lazarus and APT28 are refining their exfiltration methodsâ€”using webhooks and adopting RaaS (Medusa) to fund espionage. A significant wave of critical vulnerabilities in SolarWinds, Zyxel, and VMware highlights persistent risks in edge and management software, while the ShinyHunters group continues a high-profile extortion spree against major consumer and hospitality brands.
